tuv.seg: A pre-nuptial agreement (also called an ante-nuptial agreement) is an agreement entered into by a couple before they get married
Comhaontú ina n-iontrálann lánúin sula bpóstar iad is ea comhaontú réamhphósta
In some cases a couple may enter into a post-nuptial agreement after they get married
I roinnt cásanna, féadfaidh lánúin iontráil i gcomhaontú réamhphósta tar éis go bpóstar iad

Pre-nuptial agreements vary according to each couple’s particular circumstances but generally they make provision for financial and property matters, and other issues, following the breakdown of the marriage

Is éagsúil do chomhaontuithe réamhphósta de réir cúinsí áirithe gach lánúine ach, go ginearálta, déanann siad foráil le haghaidh ábhair airgeadais agus mhaoine, agus saincheisteanna eile, tar éis go dteipeann ar an bpósadh
They can cover issues such as lump sum payments, pensions, maintenance and custody
Féadfaidh siad saincheisteanna a chuimsiú, ar nós íocaíochtaí cnapshuime, pinsean, cothabhála agus caomhnóireachta
A couple enters into an agreement in order to try and avoid a dispute if they separate
Iontrálann lánúin isteach i gcomhaontú d’fhonn iarracht a dhéanamh chun díospóid a sheachaint má fhaigheann siad idirscaradh óna chéile
Some pre-nuptial agreements cover issues arising during the marriage
Cuimsíonn roinnt comhaontuithe réamhphósta saincheisteanna a eascraíonn le linn an phósta
Under Section 113 of the Succession Act 1965 a spouse can renounce his/her legal right share in a pre-nuptial agreement
Faoi Alt 113 den Acht Comharbais, 1965, féadfaidh céile a c(h)uid cearta dlíthiúla a thréigean i gcomhaontú réamhphósta
Enforcing a pre-nuptial agreement
Comhaontú réamhphósta a fhorfheidhmiú
There is nothing in Irish law which stops a couple intending to marry from signing a pre-nuptial agreement
Níl aon rud i ndlí na hÉireann a chuireann stop ar lánúin, a bhfuil sé beartaithe acu iad féin a phósadh, ó chomhaontú réamhphósta a shíniú
Such agreements can serve as guides for the courts in judicial separation and divorce cases, however, the courts are not obliged to enforce them
Feidhmíonn na comhaontuithe seo mar threoracha do na cúirteanna i gcásanna idirscartha bhreithiúnaigh agus colscartha, ach níl aon dualgas ar na cúirteanna iad a chur i bhfeidhm
Only pre-nuptial agreements entered into following independent legal advice for both parties are likely to be taken into account
Ní dócha go gcuirfear san áireamh ach comhaontuithe réamhphósta inar iontráladh tar éis comhairle neamhspleách dlí a chur ar an mbeirt pháirtithe
The court would have to be satisfied that there had been a complete disclosure of assets before the agreement was signed
Bheadh ar an gcúirt bheith sásta go ndearnadh na sócmhainní a nochtadh ina n-iomláine sular síníodh an comhaontú
It is also advisable for the agreement to provide for reviews:
Ina theannta sin, moltar go soláthraíonn an comhaontú athbhreithnithe sna cásanna a leanas:
• If there is a major change in circumstances
• Má tháinig mórathrú ar chúinsí
Study Group on Pre-nuptial Agreements
An Grúpa Staidéir ar Chomhaontuithe Réamhphósta

In December 2006 the Government set up a group to study and report on the operation of the law with respect to pre-nuptial agreements since the introduction of divorce in 1996, taking into account constitutional requirements

I Nollaig 2006, bhunaigh an Rialtas grúpa chun staidéar agus tuairisciú a dhéanamh ar fheidhmiú an dlí maidir le comhaontuithe réamhphósta ó tugadh colscaradh isteach i 1996, agus na ceanglais bhunreachta á gcur san áireamh
In April 2007 the Report of the Study Group on Pre-nuptial Agreements (pdf) was published
In Aibreán 2007, foilsíodh Tuarascáil an Ghrúpa Staidéir ar Chomhaontuithe Réamhphósta (pdf)
The Study Group held that pre-nuptial agreements were enforceable and capable of variation under existing Irish legislation
Mhaígh an Grúpa Staidéir go raibh comhaontuithe réamhphósta infhorfheidhmithe agus go bhféadfaidís bheith éagsúil óna chéile faoi reachtaíocht reatha na hÉireann

The weight to be attached to an agreement is determined by the courts in the light of the requirement for proper provision and the relevant statutory criteria, for example, Section 20(2) of the Family Law (Divorce) Act 1996

Deimhníonn na cúirteanna an tábhacht a bhaineann le comhaontú i bhfianaise an cheanglais le haghaidh foráil cheart agus na gcritéar ábhartha reachtúil, mar shampla, Alt 20(2) den Acht um an Dlí Teaghlaigh, (Colscaradh), 1996

The report recommended that pre-nuptial agreements be legislated for by way of introducing a new Section 16(2)A of the Family Law Act 1995 and new Section 20(3)A of the Family Law (Divorce) Act 1996 so that the courts would be required to have regard to existing pre-nuptial agreements when making ancillary relief orders in judicial separation and divorce proceedings

Mhol an tuarascáil go reachtófaí na comhaontuithe réamhphósta trí Alt 16(2)A nua den Acht um an Dlí Teaghlaigh, 1995 a thabhairt isteach, mar aon le hAlt 20(3)A den Acht um an Dlí Teaghlaigh (Colscaradh), 1996 ionas go gceanglófaí ar na cúirteanna aird a bheith ar na comhaontuithe reatha réamhphósta agus orduithe coimhdeacha faoisimh á ndéanamh acu in imeachtaí idirscartha bhreithiúnaigh agus colscartha
The report also recommended that the legislation should contain procedural guidelines
Anuas air sin, moladh sa tuarascáil gur cheart don reachtaíocht treoirlínte maidir le nós imeachta a chuimsiú
A pre-nuptial agreement would have to comply with general contractual principles and it recommended that for it to be an enforceable agreement it must be:
Bheadh ar chomhaontú réamhphósta na prionsabail ghinearálta chonarthacha a chomhlíonadh agus moladh nach mór do chomhaontú infhorfheidhmithe bheith:
• In writing, signed and witnessed
• I scríbhinn, sínithe agus duine bheith mar fhinné air
• Made after each party has received separate legal advice
• A bheith déanta tar éis go bhfuair gach páirtí comhairle dlí ar leith
• Made with full disclosure of financial information
• Déanta agus an fhaisnéis airgeadais a nochtadh go hiomlán
• Made not less than 28 days before the marriage
• Déanta tráth nach lú ná 28 lá roimh an bpósadh
The report also recommended that pre-nuptial agreements be reviewable on death
Ina theannta sin, moladh sa tuarascáil gur féidir athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar chomhaontuithe réamhphósta ar bás duine

This is so that a court may make financial provision for a surviving spouse who may be unfairly affected by the provisions of a pre-nuptial agreement on the death of the other spouse in certain circumstances

Is amhlaidh a socraíodh seo gur féidir le cúirt foráil airgeadais a dhéanamh le haghaidh céile marthanach a bhféadfadh difear a dhéanamh dó/di ag an gcomhaontú réamhphósta ar bás an chéile eile faoi chúinsí áirithe
The report’s recommendations have not yet been implemented
Níor cuireadh i bhfeidhm moltaí na tuarascála go fóill
